text:
Hey,

​

I know it may sound weird but know that there are and will be people there to support you. You can contact a suicide helpline and try to reach out to them, here are some information that may help you. If your not okay with phone call, talk chat and whatever happens: be honest about your pain so that they can try their hardest to help you and maybe give you one of the best advices to re-connect.

National Suicide Prevention Lifeline:  [https://suicidepreventionlifeline.org/](https://suicidepreventionlifeline.org/)

Phone Number:  **1-800-273-8255**

Live Chat: [http://chat.suicidepreventionlifeline.org/GetHelp/LifelineChat.aspx?\_ga=2.38028963.1444849951.1579782001-1913130080.1579782001](http://chat.suicidepreventionlifeline.org/GetHelp/LifelineChat.aspx?_ga=2.38028963.1444849951.1579782001-1913130080.1579782001)

​

Everything is going to be fine, don't give up. Life is maybe hard but you will get through this like all of us are.

Message me if you need anything.

\- Omar.

Hey,

​

I know life is hard but we both know that you don't really wanna die. Kevin Hines survived the Golden Gate suicide and he was able to tell his story. I suggest you to watch his story here:

Story talking about it: [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WcSUs9iZv-g](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WcSUs9iZv-g)

If you don't feel understood by many people, there are suicide hotlines to help you.

I know the conversation can and will be difficult but we both know that crisis passes: 

 **1-800-273-8255** 

If you live outside of the US, search up: <your country name> suicide helpline on Google.

Hopefully that helps.

Everything is going to be fine, message me if you need anything.

\- Omar
damn, i feel u man but know that people are here for u. dm me if u need anything
alright, i will tell my friend. thanks
